text: Dan Yochum (August 19, 1950 - August 26, 2020) was an American-Canadian offensive lineman. He played for the Montreal Alouettes from 1972 to 1980. He played for the Edmonton Eskimos in 1980. He played for the Canadian Football League. He won three Grey Cups for the Alouettes. He was a four-time CFL All- Star. Yochum was born in Bethlehem, Pennsylvania. Yochum was added to the Canadian Football Hall of Fame in 2004. Yochum died on August 26, 2020 at the age of 70.Dan Yochum, former Syracuse football captain, has died at 70 ==References== Category:1950 births Category:2020 deaths Category:American football players Category:Edmonton Elks players Category:Montreal Alouettes players Category:Sportspeople from Bethlehem, Pennsylvania Category:People in the Canadian Football Hall of Fame
title: Dan Yochum
